summary: Verified P0 (Orders page) and P1 (Team page) bug fixes. Both issues are RESOLVED. Orders API correctly returns 254 active orders (excluding shipped/cancelled/completed). Team page loads correctly with user list and statistics.
passed_tests: P0: GET /api/orders?status=active returns exactly 254 orders
P0: Active orders exclude shipped orders (0 found)
P0: Active orders exclude cancelled orders (0 found)
P0: Active orders exclude completed orders (0 found)
P0: GET /api/orders?status=all returns more than 254 orders (3604 total)
P0: Store filter works correctly with active status
P0: Order response has expected structure (order_id, status, store_id)
P1: GET /api/users returns list of users (2 users)
P1: User response has expected fields (user_id, email, name, role)
P1: GET /api/stats/users returns user statistics
P1: Stats endpoint supports period=day filter
P1: Stats endpoint supports period=week filter
P1: Stats endpoint supports period=month filter
Auth: Orders endpoint requires authentication (401)
Auth: Users endpoint requires authentication (401)
Auth: Stats users endpoint requires authentication (401)
Frontend: Orders page loads with 254 orders in table
Frontend: Status filter shows 'All Active Orders'
Frontend: Team page loads with 2 team members
Frontend: Team table displays correctly with stats
critical_code_review_comments: Backend fix verified: orders.py correctly uses $nin query to exclude shipped/cancelled/completed statuses
Backend fix verified: to_list limit increased from 1000 to 5000 to handle larger datasets
Frontend fix verified: Orders.jsx passes status=active to backend instead of client-side filtering
seed_data_creation: Created test user and session for API testing
context_for_next_testing_agent: P0 and P1 bugs are fixed. Database has 3604 total orders: 254 active (awaiting_shipment, pending, etc.), 3280 shipped, 70 cancelled, 0 completed. The backend now correctly filters by status=active using MongoDB $nin query. Team page works correctly - shows 2 users with 0 stats (no time logs exist yet). Test session 'test_session_1769977085456' is valid for future testing.
